metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（大满超级站气象要素梯度观测系统-2015）
metadata.description:
This data set contains the data of meteorological element gradient observation system of the middle reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to December 31, 2015.The station is located in the farmland of daman irrigation district of zhangye city, gansu province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.3722e, 38.8555n and 1556m above sea level.The wind speed/direction, air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 3m, 5m, 10m, 15m, 20m, 30m and 40m respectively, with a total of 7 layers, facing due north.The barometer is installed at 2m;The tilting bucket rain gauge was installed at about 8m on the west side of the tower, with a height of 2.5m;The four-component radiometer is installed at 12m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 12m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.Soil heat flow plate (self-calibration formal) (3 pieces) were buried in the ground 6cm in turn, 2m away from the tower body due south, two of which (Gs_2 and Gs_3) were buried between the trees, and one (Gs_1) was buried under the plants.The mean soil temperature sensor TCAV is buried 2cm and 4cm underground, facing due south and 2m away from the tower body.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The photosynthetic effective radiometer is installed at 12m with the probe facing vertically upward.Four other photosynthetically active radiometers were installed above and inside the canopy, 12m above the canopy (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), and 0.3m above the canopy (one probe vertically up and one probe vertically down), facing due south.
The observation items are: wind speed (WS_3m, WS_5m, WS_10m, WS_15m, WS_20m, WS_30m, WS_40m) (unit: m/s), wind direction (WD_3m, WD_5m, WD_10m, WD_15m, WD_20m, WD_30m, WD_40m) (unit:Air temperature and humidity (Ta_3m, Ta_5m, Ta_10m, Ta_15m, Ta_20m, Ta_30m, Ta_40m and RH_3m, RH_5m, RH_10m, RH_15m, RH_20m, RH_30m, RH_40m) (unit: Celsius, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit:Watts/m2), surface radiant temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: Celsius), average soil temperature (TCAV) (unit: Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit:Soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm)Mmol/m s) and the upward and downward photosynthetic effective radiation (PAR_D_up, PAR_D_down) under the canopy (in mmol/m s).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;The wind speed and direction of 3m and 5m were missing due to sensor problems between November 16 and November 25, 2015;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: June 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游大满超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米田。观测点的经纬度是100.3722E, 38.8555N，海拔1556m。风速/风向、空气温度、相对湿度传感器分别架设在3m、5m、10m、15m、20m、30m、40m处，共7层，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在塔西侧约8m处，架高2.5m；四分量辐射仪安装在12m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在12m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，朝向正南距离塔体2m处，其中两块（Gs_2、Gs_3）埋设在棵间，一块（Gs_1）埋设在植株下面；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，朝向正南，距离塔体2m处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm和160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；光合有效辐射仪安装在12m处，探头朝向是垂直向上；另有四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在12m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.3m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：风速（WS_3m、WS_5m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_30m、WS_40m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_3m、WD_5m、WD_10m、WD_15m、WD_20m、WD_30m、WD_40m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_3m、Ta_5m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_30m、Ta_40m和RH_3m、RH_5m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_30m、RH_40m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度) 、光合有效辐射（PAR）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；3m和5m风速和风向在2015.11.16-11.25间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于估算不同植被类型、植被覆盖度、气候和空间尺度下的蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体表现为E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用了地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热成像相机获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层级嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，特别是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据收集方法的例子，用于测量强烈对流灌溉农业区域的土壤和冠层组件温度？
Example.AnswerEn: In a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area, soil and canopy component temperatures were measured using a high-resolution thermal infrared camera, manually operated on a platform, which provided thermal images approximately every 120 minutes during the daytime. These images were used to calculate soil and canopy temperatures by classifying the visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels, extracting brightness temperatures, and converting them to radiation temperatures using long-wave radiation data.
Example.AnswerCn: 在一个强烈对流的灌溉农业区，使用高分辨率热红外相机测量了土壤和冠层组件的温度，该相机在一个平台上手动操作，白天每约120分钟提供一次热图像。这些图像用于通过将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素，提取亮度温度，并使用长波辐射数据将其转换为辐射温度。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you describe an example of a data quality control process used for hydrometeorological data collection in an oasis–desert system?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否描述一个用于绿洲-沙漠系统的水文气象数据收集的数据质量控制过程的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: The data quality control process for hydrometeorological data collection in an oasis–desert system involves sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. This includes ensuring the consistency and accuracy of measurements such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, and other related parameters, with data being collected at set intervals (e.g., every 10 minutes) and subjected to careful quality checks throughout the process.
Example.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，水文气象数据收集的数据质量控制过程包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。这包括确保辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面及其他相关参数的测量一致性和准确性，数据以设定的时间间隔（例如每10分钟）进行收集，并在整个过程中进行仔细的质量检查。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'multiscale observations' in the context of eco-hydrological processes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文过程的背景下，“多尺度观测”是指在不同空间和时间尺度上进行的观察和测量。这种方法可以帮助研究人员理解生态系统和水文过程之间的相互作用，以及它们在不同尺度下的变化和影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations refer to the collection of data at various spatial and temporal scales to capture the complexities of eco-hydrological processes. This involves using instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain comprehensive data that can address the challenge of upscaling processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测是指在不同的空间和时间尺度上收集数据，以捕捉生态水文过程的复杂性。这涉及在层次嵌套的尺度上使用仪器，以获取全面的数据，从而应对在异质表面上进行过程上升的挑战。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is 'ground-based measurement data' utilized in estimating evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Definition.QuestionCn: “基于地面测量的数据”如何在农业地区估算蒸散发？
Definition.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurement data is used to partition evapotranspiration into its components, evaporation and transpiration, by applying models like the Craig–Gordon model. These measurements include parameters such as soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for accurately estimating evapotranspiration using models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Definition.AnswerCn: 地面测量数据用于通过应用像Craig-Gordon模型这样的模型将蒸散发分为其组成部分，即蒸发和蒸腾。这些测量包括土壤和冠层组件温度等参数，这些参数对于使用像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型准确估计蒸散发至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What constitutes 'quality control' in the context of hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，'质量控制'的构成包括以下几个方面：数据的准确性、完整性、一致性和及时性。质量控制的过程通常涉及数据的验证、校正和审核，以确保所收集的数据符合预定的标准和要求。此外，还包括对数据收集设备的定期维护和校准，以减少系统误差和提高数据的可靠性。
Definition.AnswerEn: Quality control in hydrometeorological data collection involves ensuring data accuracy and reliability through sensor calibration, careful data collection, processing, and dataset generation. This process includes checking for missing data, eliminating duplicate records, and removing data that falls outside of expected physical ranges or instrument limits.
Definition.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据收集中的质量控制涉及通过传感器校准、仔细的数据收集、处理和数据集生成来确保数据的准确性和可靠性。这个过程包括检查缺失数据、消除重复记录以及删除超出预期物理范围或仪器限制的数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in the Daman superstation compare to those employed in the HiWATER experiment in terms of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: Daman超级站使用的数据收集方法与HiWATER实验中采用的方法在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Daman superstation employs a set of meteorological and hydrological sensors, including air temperature, wind speed, humidity measurement, and four-component radiations, to capture localized atmospheric conditions. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment uses a broader range of instruments such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale processes over oasis-desert interactions. HiWATER also incorporates hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, which is not mentioned for the Daman superstation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 达曼超级站使用一套气象和水文传感器，包括空气温度、风速、湿度测量和四组件辐射，来捕捉局部大气条件。相比之下，HiWATER实验使用更广泛的仪器，如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，这些仪器按层次嵌套的尺度排列，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用的多尺度过程。HiWATER还结合了超高分辨率的航空遥感，而达曼超级站没有提到这一点。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the deployment of multiple sensors at varying heights and depths, as seen in a meteorological observation network, help in understanding the microclimatic variations within an agricultural field?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在气象观测网络中，部署多个传感器于不同高度和深度，可以帮助理解农业田间的微气候变化。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The deployment of multiple sensors at various heights and depths allows researchers to capture detailed vertical profiles of environmental variables such as wind speed, air temperature, humidity, and soil conditions. This setup helps in understanding the microclimatic variations, as it provides insights into how these variables change with altitude and depth, offering a comprehensive view of the interactions between the atmosphere and the surface in an agricultural setting.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在不同高度和深度部署多个传感器，使研究人员能够捕捉环境变量（如风速、空气温度、湿度和土壤条件）的详细垂直剖面。这种设置有助于理解微气候变化，因为它提供了这些变量如何随高度和深度变化的见解，从而全面了解大气与农业表面之间的相互作用。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways might the challenges of obtaining accurate component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes affect the interpretation of energy balance models?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中获取准确的组件温度的挑战可能会如何影响能量平衡模型的解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in obtaining accurate component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes can lead to errors in estimating the energy partition between soil and canopy layers. This affects the interpretation of energy balance models by introducing uncertainties in calculating sensible and latent heat fluxes. Such inaccuracies can misrepresent the balance of energy exchanges in these landscapes, potentially leading to incorrect assessments of evapotranspiration and related processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中获取准确的组分温度所面临的挑战可能导致在估算土壤和树冠层之间的能量分配时出现错误。这会影响能量平衡模型的解释，因为在计算显热和潜热通量时引入了不确定性。这种不准确性可能会错误地表述这些景观中的能量交换平衡，从而导致对蒸散发及相关过程的错误评估。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area using the TSEB model?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域中，使用TSEB模型准确估计表面通量面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is challenging primarily due to the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences. Errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature can lead to overestimation, affecting the TSEB model's performance. Additionally, the strong advective environment further complicates accurate estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量具有挑战性，主要是由于表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被成分温度的误差可能导致过高估计，从而影响TSEB模型的性能。此外，强对流环境进一步复杂化了准确估计的过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there an issue with the effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性存在问题？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions is limited due to image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance. Specifically, soil pixels may be misclassified as vegetation pixels, leading to an overestimation of canopy temperature. Furthermore, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in temperature estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性受到限制，主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。具体而言，土壤像素可能被错误分类为植被像素，从而导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能会引入温度估计的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the poor availability of multiscale observations for upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在异质表面上进行生态水文过程上尺度化时多尺度观测稀缺的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The poor availability of multiscale observations for upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is primarily due to the lack of comprehensive, multiscale, and multidisciplinary data. The complexity of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes requires extensive instrumentation and data collection efforts, which are often not readily available.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测在异质表面上进行生态水文过程上升的可用性差，主要是由于缺乏全面的、多尺度的和多学科的数据。捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的复杂性需要广泛的仪器和数据收集工作，而这些往往并不容易获得。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges that arise from using ground-based measurements combined with thermal infrared imaging for estimating evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用地面测量与热红外成像相结合来估算农业地区的蒸散发可能面临的潜在挑战有哪些？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: One challenge in using ground-based measurements combined with thermal infrared imaging for estimating evapotranspiration is the difficulty in accurately measuring soil and canopy component temperatures due to image classification errors. These errors can lead to an overestimation of canopy temperature, particularly in areas with developing vegetation abundance. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in temperature estimates, affecting the accuracy of evapotranspiration modeling.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量结合热红外成像来估算蒸散发的一个挑战是，由于图像分类错误，准确测量土壤和冠层成分温度的困难。这些错误可能导致冠层温度的过高估计，特别是在植被丰度正在发展的区域。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能会引入温度估计的不确定性，从而影响蒸散发模型的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the purpose of implementing a multiscale observation system in eco-hydrological research within oasis-desert areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文研究中，实施多尺度观测系统的目的是为了什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The purpose is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data through instruments arranged on hierarchically nested scales. This allows for the capture of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and interactions in oasis-desert systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目的是通过在层次嵌套的尺度上布置仪器，获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以应对在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战。这使得能够捕捉到绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程和相互作用。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to accurately estimate soil and canopy component temperatures in the TSEB model for evapotranspiration estimation?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在TSEB模型中，准确估计土壤和冠层组分温度对于蒸散发估算的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Accurate estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures is crucial for the TSEB model's performance as it affects the separation of latent heat fluxes into soil and vegetation components, which is necessary for reliable estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration, especially in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组分温度的准确估计对TSEB模型的性能至关重要，因为它影响将潜热通量分离为土壤和植被组分，这对于可靠估计蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发尤其重要，特别是在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of creating a long-term dataset for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 创建一个关于绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测的长期数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives are to gain a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas, which is essential for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development. This understanding is vital for achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals and ensuring the ecological security and sustainable development of oasis regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是定量了解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。这种理解对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标、确保绿洲地区的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific procedures involved in setting up and maintaining a hydrometeorological observation network in an oasis-desert area?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区建立和维护水文气象观测网络的具体程序包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedures involve arranging instruments on hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, constructing a superstation within the oasis, installing eddy covariance towers, scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations in different landscapes, and conducting intensive observations at the irrigation district scale. The data are carefully quality controlled through sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and dataset generation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 这些程序涉及在分层嵌套的尺度上安排仪器，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，在绿洲内构建超级站，在不同的景观中安装涡度协方差塔、闪烁仪和自动气象站，并在灌溉区尺度上进行密集观测。数据通过传感器校准、数据收集、处理和数据集生成进行仔细的质量控制。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is data quality ensured and controlled in large-scale environmental observational studies, particularly in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在大规模环境观测研究中，特别是在干旱地区，如何确保和控制数据质量？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality is ensured through a rigorous process that includes sensor calibration, thorough data collection procedures, systematic data processing, and meticulous dataset generation. Observational data are subject to continuous quality control throughout these stages to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量通过严格的过程得以确保，包括传感器校准、全面的数据收集程序、系统的数据处理和细致的数据集生成。在这些阶段，观测数据会受到持续的质量控制，以确保准确性和可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What steps are taken to accurately separate soil and vegetation component temperatures using remote sensing in an agricultural area?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
在农业区域中，准确分离土壤和植被成分温度的步骤包括：

1. **数据收集**：使用遥感技术获取高分辨率的热红外影像，通常使用卫星或无人机进行数据采集。

2. **影像预处理**：对收集到的遥感影像进行辐射校正、大气校正和几何校正，以确保数据的准确性和一致性。

3. **植被指数计算**：计算植被指数（如NDVI）以评估植被覆盖度和健康状况，这有助于理解植被对温度的影响。

4. **温度分离模型**：应用温度分离模型（如双源模型或单源模型）来估算土壤和植被的温度。这些模型通常基于能量平衡原理。

5. **地面验证**：在研究区域内进行地面实测，收集土壤和植被的实际温度数据，以验证和校正遥感数据的结果。

6. **数据分析与解释**：分析分离出的土壤和植被温度数据，结合其他农业信息（如土壤湿度、作物生长阶段等）进行综合解读。

7. **结果应用**：将分离出的温度数据应用于农业管理决策，如灌溉调度、作物健康监测和病虫害预警等。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The process includes manually operating a thermal infrared camera to capture thermal radiation images of cropland, classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels using a maximum-likelihood method, extracting soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures from the thermal images, and converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures using long-wave radiation data and emissivities. These simulated temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures obtained from a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程包括手动操作热红外相机捕捉农田的热辐射图像，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度，并利用长波辐射数据和发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。这些模拟温度与从四分量辐射计获得的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods or technologies enable the accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in a heterogeneous landscape?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法或技术能够在异质景观中准确分离土壤和植被成分的温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a high-resolution thermal infrared camera enables the accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures by capturing thermal images. These images are then classified into soil and canopy pixels using methods like the maximum-likelihood approach. The radiometric temperatures are validated against observed surface temperatures to ensure accuracy.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热红外相机可以通过捕捉热图像准确分离土壤和植被成分的温度。这些图像随后使用最大似然法等方法分类为土壤像素和冠层像素。辐射温度与观测到的表面温度进行验证，以确保准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of multiscale observation systems enable comprehensive data collection in eco-hydrological studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测系统的集成如何在生态水文研究中实现全面的数据收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation systems enable comprehensive data collection by employing a combination of tools such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing instruments. These tools capture data at different scales, which provides a holistic view of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测系统通过结合涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和超高分辨率航空遥感仪器等工具，实现全面的数据收集。这些工具在不同尺度上捕获数据，从而提供对异质景观中生态水文过程的整体视角。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or technological setups are necessary for conducting effective long-term monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 进行有效的长期监测干旱地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换所需的条件或技术设置是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Effective long-term monitoring requires the establishment of land surface flux and meteorological stations equipped with eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, as well as automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological parameters. Additionally, datasets should include auxiliary data such as vegetation and soil parameters, with comprehensive data processing and quality control procedures in place.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 有效的长期监测需要建立配备涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的地表通量和气象站，以获取湍流通量数据，以及用于水文气象参数的自动气象站。此外，数据集应包括辅助数据，如植被和土壤参数，并应建立全面的数据处理和质量控制程序。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the data collection method for eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas face challenges in capturing multiscale observations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，生态水文过程的数据收集方法可能面临挑战，难以捕捉多尺度观测的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in the field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The HiWATER experiment addresses this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, but obtaining comprehensive multiscale and multidisciplinary data remains complex.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制。HiWATER实验通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置来应对这一挑战，但获取全面的多尺度和多学科数据仍然复杂。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that estimating evapotranspiration (ET) using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is challenging in strongly advective agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流农业区域，使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估计蒸散发（ET）被认为是具有挑战性的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Estimating surface fluxes in such areas is difficult because the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The TSEB model's performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference, which can be dominant due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the composite radiometric temperature.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在这些区域估算表面通量是困难的，因为H和LE的EC通量测量与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合的不完整性。TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响，这种不确定性可能由于从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of the data collection methods used in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程时所使用的数据收集方法的有效性有何评估？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods appear to be well-structured for capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes, as they involve a hierarchical arrangement of instruments, intensive observation periods, and a range of technologies including eddy covariance towers, LiDAR, and thermal imaging. This comprehensive approach allows for detailed observations across different scales and disciplines, enhancing the understanding of oasis-desert interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法似乎结构良好，能够捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，因为它们涉及仪器的分层安排、密集的观察周期以及包括涡度协方差塔、激光雷达和热成像在内的多种技术。这种综合方法允许在不同尺度和学科之间进行详细观察，增强了对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the challenges faced in acquiring accurate component temperatures for use in evapotranspiration estimation models in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在干旱地区获取准确组件温度以用于蒸散发估算模型所面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges in acquiring accurate component temperatures are significant due to image classification errors and environmental factors like strong advection. These challenges can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures and uncertainties in radiation estimates, which impact the performance of evapotranspiration models. Addressing these challenges requires precise temperature measurements and validation against ground-based data.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 获取准确的组件温度面临重大挑战，这主要是由于图像分类错误和强对流等环境因素。这些挑战可能导致对冠层温度的高估以及辐射估计的不确定性，从而影响蒸散发模型的性能。解决这些挑战需要精确的温度测量，并与地面数据进行验证。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't comprehend how data collection methods for soil and canopy component temperatures are conducted in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，土壤和树冠成分温度的数据收集方法是如何进行的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the field above, soil and canopy component temperatures were measured using thermal images collected every 120 minutes from a Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera manually operated on a 25-m-high platform. These images were then used to calculate the soil and canopy component temperatures, which were validated against surface radiometric temperatures obtained from a four-component radiometer.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在上述领域中，土壤和冠层组件的温度通过每120分钟收集一次的热成像进行测量，这些热成像是使用手动操作的Fluke Ti55热红外相机在25米高的平台上拍摄的。然后，这些图像用于计算土壤和冠层组件的温度，并与从四组件辐射计获得的表面辐射温度进行了验证。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please detail the data collection methods and instrumental setups used for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请详细说明用于观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法和仪器设置。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in oasis–desert ecosystems involve the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data. The hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature, humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, are observed using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. Groundwater table data and auxiliary datasets on vegetation and soil parameters are also collected.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据。水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度、湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面，使用自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测。同时，还收集地下水位数据和关于植被及土壤参数的辅助数据集。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Describe the challenges associated with data collection for estimating evapotranspiration using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业地区，使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估算蒸散发时，数据收集面临的挑战包括：
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection for estimating evapotranspiration using the TSEB model include the difficulty of accurately separating soil and vegetation component temperatures due to errors in image classification, which vary with vegetation abundance. There are also uncertainties in estimating the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy, and errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature, especially in strongly advective environments.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 使用TSEB模型估算蒸散发的数据收集面临的挑战包括，由于图像分类中的误差，准确分离土壤和植被成分温度的困难，这种误差随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，在估算通过树冠的入射短波和长波辐射透过率时也存在不确定性，以及在强烈的平流环境中，从表面复合辐射温度确定表面土壤和植被成分温度时的误差。
